revision.text:
{{Infobox television episode | title =Eat, Pray, Queef | series =South Park | image = | caption =The men of South Park record the charity single "Queef Free" to raise queefing awareness | season =13 | episode =4 | airdate =April 1, 2009 | production =1304 | writer = Trey Parker | director = [[Trey Parker]] | guests = | season_article = South Park (season 13) | episode_list = List of South Park episodes | prev =[[Margaritaville (South Park)|Margaritaville]] | next =[[Fishsticks (South Park)|Fishsticks]] }} "'''Eat, Pray, Queef'''" is the fourth episode of the [[South Park (season 13)|thirteenth season]] of the American animated television series ''[[South Park]]''. The 185th overall episode of the series, it originally aired on [[Comedy Central]] in the United States on April 1, 2009. In the episode, the men and boys of South Park become infuriated when the [[fart]]-joke oriented ''[[Terrance and Phillip]]'' show is replaced with the ''Queef Sisters'', a show devoted to [[Vaginal flatulence|queef]] jokes. The women and girls of South Park accuse them of holding a [[sexism|sexist]] [[double standard]] when it comes to women queefing and men farting. The episode was written and directed by series co-founder [[Trey Parker]], and was rated [[Television content rating systems#United States|TV-MA L]] in the United States. Parker and [[Matt Stone]] originally considered doing a full-length ''Queef Sisters'' episode in the style of the [[South Park (season 2)|second season]] premiere "[[Terrance and Phillip in Not Without My Anus]]", but they decided against it based on the negative fan reaction to that episode. The episode received generally positive reviews and, according to [[Nielsen ratings|Nielsen Media Research]], was seen by more than three million households in its original airing, making it the most-watched Comedy Central production of the week. The title is a reference to the [[Elizabeth Gilbert]] book ''[[Eat, Pray, Love]]''; the episode also included references to [[Martha Stewart]] and the film ''[[Mad Max 2|The Road Warrior]]''. The episode ends with the South Park men recording "Queef Free", a charity song in the style of "[[We Are The World]]" mixed with lyrics from "[[I Am Woman]]". "Eat, Pray, Queef" was released on [[DVD]] and [[Blu-ray disc|Blu-ray]] along with the rest of the thirteenth season on March 16, 2010. ==Plot== The boys of South Park Elementary School are anxiously awaiting the night's episode of ''[[Terrance and Phillip]]'', which ended in a cliffhanger last season, while the girls at the school express disgust over the show and the boys' obsession with fart jokes. Cartman retaliates by farting in a little girl's face, which causes all the boys to laugh. After school, the boys gather in Cartman's house to watch the episode. To their horror, it is then revealed that, as an [[April Fools' Day]] joke, the channel is airing a new show called the ''Queef Sisters'', about [[Canadians|Canadian]] sisters Katherine (voiced by Trey Parker) and Katie Queef (voiced by Matt Stone). They are very similar to Terrance and Phillip, but instead of fart jokes, they make [[Vaginal flatulence|queef]] jokes. The show starts a queefing movement across the country, and men everywhere get upset and disgusted by the queefs, although the women do not understand what the problem is. Though the women of South Park argue that there is no difference between queefing and farting, the men are revolted by queefs, while still finding their own fart jokes amusing. Meanwhile, Terrance and Phillip are furious their show got replaced with ''The Queef Sisters'', sharing the American Men's disgust of queef jokes. When the producer asks why they think fart jokes are funny, but are revolted by queef jokes, Terrance says it's "because babies come from there." As a joke mirroring Cartman's, one of the girls at school queefs on [[Butters Stotch|Butters]]' face, causing him to run screaming and crying out of the school building. The other boys are shocked and their fathers, outraged, go to the [[Colorado General Assembly]] and demand a law banning queefing, much to the anger of the town's women. Meanwhile, the Queef Sisters appear on ''[[Regis and Kelly]]'' to promote their book ''Eat, Pray, Queef'', and Terrance and Philip's show gets canceled due to the rising popularity of the Queef Sisters. Terrance and Philip attempt to kill the Queef Sisters, but the plan backfires when they end up becoming attracted to them after the Queef Sisters mention that Terrence and Phillip are the sisters' idols. They pair off into couples and travel the [[Canadian wine|Canadian Wine Country]] together. Meanwhile, after [[Stan Marsh|Stan]]'s mother [[Randy and Sharon Marsh|Sharon]] queefs, she and Stan's sister, [[List of South Park families#Shelley Marsh|Shelley]], start laughing at the dinner table, causing Stan and his father [[Randy and Sharon Marsh|Randy]] to leave. Feeling sorry for Butters, the South Park boys testify in the case in the [[Colorado Senate|Colorado State Senate]] about the girl who queefed on Butters. A debate on the senate floor culminates with a female senator queefing almost exact lines of dialogue from ''[[Mad Max 2|The Road Warrior]]'' film. The next day, the newspapers announce that, partly due to the senator's stunt the previous day, the queefing ban has passed. As Stan and his father Randy celebrate, Sharon and Shelley are hurt and insulted by the decision, describing it as an example of [[sexism]] that still pervades society, and finally sarcastically congratulate the men for "getting their own way... again." Stan and Randy finally understand the issue was not simply about queefing, but a larger point about women's rights. The two get all the South Park men together and record an inspirational song called "Queef Free", declaring women should have the right to queef, while photographs of women working various careers are displayed on a television screen. Terrance and Philip, despite a continued disgust with the constant queefing, attempt to marry the two Queef Sisters. The vicar leaves the ceremony in disgust as the couples repeatedly fart and queef on him, pronouncing them "Farts and Queefs" as he leaves. ==Production== {{Quote box |quoted=true |bgcolor=#FFFFF0 |salign=center |width=200px |align=right | quote = There are moments when you're doing a stupid TV show where it really strikes you how stupid your job is, and one is where we were doing the queefs, and they're jumping up and queefing in their face. It was like, "I have the dumbest job ever." | source = '''[[Matt Stone]],
''[[South Park]] co-creator''''' }} "Eat, Pray, Queef" was written and directed by series co-founder [[Trey Parker]]. It first aired on April 1, 2009 in the United States on [[Comedy Central]].{{cite news |last=Lewinski |first=John Scott |title=Creative Chaos Keeps ''South Park'' Timely, Tack-Sharp |work=[[Wired (magazine)|Wired]] |date=2009-03-31 |url=http://blog.wired.com/underwire/2009/03/stone-unveils-s.html |accessdate=2009-04-03}} Although Parker and fellow co-creator [[Matt Stone]] acknowledged it was a particularly juvenile episode, Parker said it was his favorite show of the season to produce. He said, "I seriously never laughed as hard doing retakes, just going shot-by-shot, sitting there in the editing room laughing."{{Cite video | people=[[Trey Parker|Parker, Trey]]| date=November 2010 |title=South Park: The Complete Thirteenth Season: "Eat, Pray, Queef" |format=Audio commentary |medium= Blu-ray Disc|publisher=[[Paramount Pictures#Paramount Home Entertainment|Paramount Home Entertainment]]}} During the writing process, the female producers and employees with the show found the script largely unfunny, disgusting and offensive. They reportedly claimed vaginal flatulence would not bloom into a proud women's movement as it did in the episode, but Parker and Stone insisted that was what made the concept even funnier.{{Cite video | people=[[Matt Stone|Stone, Matt]]| date=November 2010 |title=South Park: The Complete Thirteenth Season: "Eat, Pray, Queef" |format=Audio commentary |medium=Blu-ray Disc|publisher=[[Paramount Pictures#Paramount Home Entertainment|Paramount Home Entertainment]]}} Originally, Parker and Stone considered making a full-length episode of ''The Queef Sisters''. The duo had pulled a similar stunt with the [[South Park (season 2)|second season]] premiere. Instead of the expected follow-up to "[[Cartman's Mom Is a Dirty Slut]]", in which the identity of Cartman's father was to be revealed, Parker and [[Matt Stone]] showed the episode "[[Terrance and Phillip in Not Without My Anus]]", a Terrance and Phillip-centered episode as an [[April Fools' Day]] prank.{{Cite news |last=Lynch |first=Kelvin |title=Laugh of the day: Martha Stewart does a good thing for spring |date=2009-04-02 |work=The Philadelphia Examiner}} Since "Eat, Pray, Queef" was coincidentally also set to air on April Fools' Day, they considered a similar joke revolving around Katherine and Katie. However, since "Terrance and Phillip in Not Without My Anus" infuriated ''South Park'' fans at the time, they decided not to do it and wrote a full script for "Eat, Pray, Queef" instead. The original prank is referenced in the episode, when [[Canadian Broadcasting Corporation|The Canada Channel]] announces that it will not air a much-anticipated part two episode of Terrance and Phillip, and instead will show the ''Queef Sisters'' as an [[April Fools' Day]] prank. The angry reaction from the boys mirrors the real-life fan reaction to the ''South Park'' second season premiere. The episode uses the characters' conflicting responses to the comedic value of farts and queefs to demonstrate a double standard between rights of men and women, even in the 21st century, as both genders hold unfair opinions toward the other sex, and the episode suggests men and women are, and should be, equals.{{Cite news |last=Payne |first=Niki |title=Queefing vs. Farting |date=2009-04-02 |work=The Philadelphia Examiner}}{{Cite news |last=Delgado |first=Carlos |title=TV Review: South Park – Season 13 – "Eat, Pray, Queef" |work=iF Magazine |date=2009-04-02}} Shortly after "Eat, Pray, Queef" was originally broadcast, the site also featured T-shirts and hooded sweatshirts based on the episode. One featured Katherine and Katie [[queefing]] and saying, "Babies come from there!"{{Cite web |title=southpark: Babies Come From There! |work=[[Zazzle]] |date=2009-04-02 |url=http://www.zazzle.com/southpark/gifts?cg=196865231560843231 |accessdate=2009-11-19}} ==Cultural references== [[Image:Martha Stewart 5 Shankbone Metropolitan Opera 2009.jpg|thumb|190 px|right|[[Martha Stewart]] and her television show, ''[[The Martha Stewart Show]]'', are mocked in "Eat, Pray, Queef".]] The book ''Eat, Pray, Queef'' by the Queef Sisters, which is also the source of the episode's title, is a [[satire|satirical]] reference to the book ''[[Eat, Pray, Love]]'' written by [[Elizabeth Gilbert]]. There is a brief scene in which television host [[Martha Stewart]] provides instruction on ways to decorate queefs on ''[[The Martha Stewart Show]]''. Television show hosts [[Regis Philbin]] and [[Kelly Ripa]] interview Katie and Katherine on their show, ''Live with Regis and Kelly''. One of the queefs released by a woman in the episode includes exact dialogue from the 1981 action film ''[[Mad Max 2|The Road Warrior]]''.{{Cite news |last=Modell |first=Josh |title=Eat, Pray, Queef |work=[[The A.V. Club]] |date=2009-04-02 |url=http://www.avclub.com/articles/eat-pray-queef,26087/ |accessdate=2009-04-03}} The montage sequence where Terrance and Phillip take Katherine and Katie on a tour of Canadian wine country is a parody of a similar montage sequence in the 2004 comedy film "[[Sideways]]".{{Cite web |title=Episode 1304 – Eat, Pray, Queef |work=[[IMDB Movie Connections]] |date=2009-04-02 |url=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0375063/movieconnections |accessdate=2011-07-29}} The men's anthem "Queef Free" is a parody of "[[We Are The World]]", the 1985 celebrities-for-charity song written by [[Michael Jackson]] and [[Lionel Richie]].{{Cite news|last=Anderson |first=Thomas |title=Men Farting, Women Queefing |date=2009-04-01 |url=http://www.screenjunkies.com/recap/men-farting-women-queefing |accessdate=2009-05-10 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5u4sCHxRK?url=http://www.screenjunkies.com/recap/men-farting-women-queefing |archivedate=2010-11-08 |df= }} Within the episode, [[Canadian Broadcasting Corporation|The Canada Channel]] announces that, as an [[April Fools' Day]] prank, it will be airing the new Queef Sisters show instead of the much-anticipated part two episode of Terrance and Phillip. This is a reference to the ''South Park'' second season premiere. Instead of the expected follow-up to "[[Cartman's Mom Is a Dirty Slut]]", in which the identity of Cartman's father was to be revealed, Parker and [[Matt Stone]] showed the episode "[[Terrance and Phillip in Not Without My Anus]]", a Terrance and Phillip-centered episode as an April Fools' Day prank. The move infuriated ''South Park'' fans. ==Reception== A preview clip of the episode listed on South Park Studios, the official ''South Park'' website, during the week before the episode's broadcast was viewed more than 50,000 times. In its original American broadcast, "Eat, Pray, Queef" was watched by three million households overall, according to the [[Nielsen ratings|Nielsen Media Research]], making it the most-watched Comedy Central production of the week. It had over one million more household viewers than the second most watched Comedy Central show that week, the April 1 episode of ''[[The Daily Show]]''.{{Cite web|title=''Damages'' season finale draws few, ''WWE RAW'', ''NCIS'' lead cable viewing |last=Seidman |first=Robert |date=2009-04-07 |work=TV by the Numbers |url=http://tvbythenumbers.com/2009/04/07/damages-season-finale-draws-few-wwe-raw-ncis-lead-cable-viewing/16141#more-16141 |accessdate=2009-04-07 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5u1hd99Jv?url=http://tvbythenumbers.com/2009/04/07/damages-season-finale-draws-few-wwe-raw-ncis-lead-cable-viewing/16141 |archivedate=2010-11-06 |df= }} Niki Payne of the ''Philadelphia Examiner'' said "Eat, Pray, Queef" was "probably one of my all-time favorite episodes of ''South Park'' right now" because it was so on point concerning the double standards between men and women. She particularly praised the scene in which Stan and Randy are disgusted and uncomfortable when Stan's mom and sister started queefing at the dinner table. Carlos Delgado of ''If Magazine'' said the episode was "shocking, disgusting and obscenely funny" and demonstrated ''South Park'''s ability to tackle any type of issue "in a uniquely ''South Park'' manner". He particularly enjoyed the Martha Stewart segment, which he described as "just haunting". Josh Modell of ''[[The A.V. Club]]'' gave the episode a B grade. Modell said the Katie and Katherine cartoon was particularly funny, but queefing was referred to in so many jokes that it became a bit tired by the end. Some reviewers were less laudatory. Travis Fickett of [[IGN]] said the episode was "a textbook example of a disappointing ''South Park''". He said the jokes were predictable, lazy, boring, and that Terrance and Phillip are not funny enough to carry large portions of an episode.{{Cite news |last=Fickett |first=Travis |title=South Park: "Eat, Pray, Queef" Review |publisher=[[IGN]] |date=2009-04-02 |url=http://tv.ign.com/articles/969/969056p1.html |accessdate=2009-04-03}} ==Home release== "Eat, Pray, Queef", along with the thirteen other episodes from ''South Park'''s thirteenth season, were released on a three-disc [[DVD]] set and two-disc [[Blu-ray disc|Blu-ray]] set in the United States on March 16, 2010. The sets included brief audio commentaries by Parker and Stone for each episode,{{cite web|last=Foster |first=Dave |url=http://www.dvdtimes.co.uk/content.php?contentid=71969 |title=South Park Season 13 (R1/US BD) in March |publisher=DVD Times |date=December 14, 2009 |accessdate=February 24, 2010}} a collection of deleted scenes, and a special mini-feature ''Inside Xbox: A Behind-the-Scenes Tour of South Park Studios'', which discussed the process behind animating the show with ''Inside Xbox'' host [[Larry Hryb|Major Nelson]].{{Cite web |title=South Park: The Complete Thirteenth Season Blu-ray Review |publisher=Blu-ray.com |date=March 5, 2010 |last=Liebman |first=Martin |url=http://www.blu-ray.com/movies/South-Park-The-Complete-Thirteenth-Season-Blu-ray-Review/8807/ |accessdate=March 25, 2010}} ==References== {{reflist|2}} ==External links== {{wikiquote|South Park/Season_13#Eat.2C_Pray.2C_Queef_.5B13.4.5D|Eat, Pray, Queef}} * [http://www.southparkstudios.com/full-episodes/s13e04-eat-pray-queef "Eat, Pray, Queef"] Full episode at South Park Studios * [http://www.southparkstudios.com/guide/episodes/s13e04-eat-pray-queef "Eat, Pray, Queef"] Episode guide at South Park Studios *{{imdb episode|1397942}} *{{tv.com episode|south-park/eat-pray-queef-1261157}} {{good article}} {{South Park episodes|13}} [[Category:April Fools' Day]] [[Category:Canada in fiction]] [[Category:Flatulence in popular culture]] [[Category:South Park (season 13) episodes]] [[Category:Television episodes about weddings]] [[Category:Works about feminism]] [[Category:Works about sisters]]

revision.comment: I removed the link from the phrase, "interstitial fluid", because it linked to "extracellular fluid", because they are not the same thing. I deserve an MD/PhD for being able to correct medical documents.
revision.text:
{{distinguish|Adema}} {{redirect|Dropsy}} {{refimprove|date=May 2011}} {{Infobox medical condition (new) | name = Edema | image = Combinpedal.jpg | caption = "Pitting" edema | field = [[Cardiology]], [[nephrology]] | synonyms = Oedema, dropsy, hydropsy | pronounce = {{IPAc-en|ᵻ|ˈ|d|iː|m|ə}} | symptoms = | complications = | onset = | duration = | causes = | risks = | diagnosis = | differential = | prevention = | treatment = | medication = | prognosis = | frequency = | deaths = }} '''Edema''', also spelled '''oedema''' or '''œdema''', is an abnormal accumulation of fluid in the [[interstitium]], located beneath the skin and in the cavities of the body, which can cause severe pain. Clinically, edema manifests as [[swelling (medical)|swelling]]. The amount of interstitial fluid is determined by the balance of fluid [[homeostasis]] and the increased secretion of fluid into the interstitium. The word is from [[Greek language|Greek]] {{lang|grc|οἴδημα}} ''oídēma'' meaning "swelling".[http://www.perseus.tufts.edu/hopper/text?doc=Perseus%3Atext%3A1999.04.0057%3Aentry%3Doi%29%2Fdhma οἴδημα], Henry George Liddell, Robert Scott, ''A Greek-English Lexicon'', on Perseus The condition is also known (mostly archaic) as '''dropsy'''. ==Classifications== Cutaneous edema is referred to as "pitting" when, after pressure is applied to a small area, the indentation persists after the release of the pressure. [[Peripheral edema|Peripheral]] pitting edema, as shown in the illustration, is the more common type, resulting from water retention. It can be caused by systemic diseases, pregnancy in some women, either directly or as a result of [[heart failure]], or local conditions such as [[varicose veins]], [[thrombophlebitis]], insect bites, and [[dermatitis]]. Non-pitting edema is observed when the indentation does not persist. It is associated with such conditions as [[lymphedema]], [[lipedema]], and [[myxedema]]. Edema caused by malnutrition defines [[kwashiorkor]], an acute form of childhood protein-energy malnutrition characterized by edema, irritability, anorexia, ulcerating dermatoses, and an enlarged liver with fatty infiltrates. === Generalized === {|class="wikitable" align="right" |+Grading of edema[http://www.unicef.org/nutrition/training/3.1/20.html Nutrition in Emergencies > Measuring œdema]. Erin Boyd, reviewed by Diane Holland, Nutrition in Emergencies Unit, [[UNICEF]]. Retrieved Nov 2012 |- ! Grade !! Definition |- | Absent || Absent |- | Grade + || Mild: Both feet / ankles |- | Grade ++ || Moderate: Both feet,
plus lower legs,
hands or lower arms |- | Grade +++ || Severe: Generalised
bilateral pitting edema,
including both feet,
legs, arms and face |} A rise in [[hydrostatic pressure]] occurs in [[cardiac failure]]. A fall in osmotic pressure occurs in [[nephrotic syndrome]] and [[liver failure]].{{cite journal | author = Renkin EM | title = Cellular aspects of transvascular exchange: a 40-year perspective | journal = Microcirculation | volume = 1 | issue = 3 | pages = 157–67 | year = 1994 | pmid = 8790586 | doi = 10.3109/10739689409148270 }} Causes of edema which are generalized to the whole body can cause edema in multiple organs and peripherally. For example, severe heart failure can cause [[pulmonary edema]], pleural effusions, [[ascites]] and [[peripheral edema]]. Such severe systemic edema is called [[anasarca]]. In rare cases, a [[Parvovirus B19]] infection may cause generalized edemas.{{cite journal |vauthors=Wiggli B, Imhof E, Meier CA, Laifer G | title = Water, water, everywhere. Acute parvovirus B19 infection | journal = Lancet | volume = 381 | issue = 9868 | pages = 776 | year = 2013 | pmid = 23472922 | doi = 10.1016/S0140-6736(12)61894-7 }} Although a low plasma [[oncotic pressure]] is widely cited for the edema of nephrotic syndrome, most physicians note that the edema may occur before there is any significant protein in the urine ([[proteinuria]]) or fall in plasma protein level. Most forms of nephrotic syndrome are due to biochemical and structural changes in the basement membrane of capillaries in the kidney glomeruli, and these changes occur, if to a lesser degree, in the vessels of most other tissues of the body. Thus the resulting increase in permeability that leads to protein in the urine can explain the edema if all other vessels are more permeable as well.{{cite journal |vauthors=Palmer BF, Alpern RJ | title = Pathogenesis of edema formation in the nephrotic syndrome | journal = Kidney Int. Suppl. | volume = 59 | issue = | pages = S21–7 | year = 1997 | pmid = 9185099 | doi = }} As well as the previously mentioned conditions, edemas often occur during the late stages of pregnancy in some women. This is more common with those of a history of pulmonary problems or poor circulation also being intensified if arthritis is already present in that particular woman. Women that already have arthritic problems most often have to seek medical help for pain caused from over-reactive swelling. Edemas that occur during pregnancy are usually found in the lower part of the leg, usually from the calf down. === Organ-specific=== An edema will occur in specific organs as part of inflammations, [[tendonitis]] or pancreatitis, for instance. Certain organs develop edema through tissue specific mechanisms. Examples of edema in specific organs: :* Pedal edema (dependent edema of legs) is extracellular fluid accumulation in the legs. This can occur in otherwise healthy people due to hypervolemia or maintaining a standing or seated posture for an extended period of time. It can occur due to diminished venous return of blood to the heart due to congestive heart failure or pulmonary hypertension. It can also occur in patients with increased hydrostatic venous pressure or decreased oncotic venous pressure, due to obstruction of lymphatic or venous vessels draining the lower extremity. Certain drugs (for example, amolodipine) can cause pedal edema. :* [[Cerebral edema]] is extracellular fluid accumulation in the brain. It can occur in toxic or abnormal metabolic states and conditions such as systemic lupus or reduced oxygen at high altitudes. It causes drowsiness or loss of consciousness, leading to [[brain herniation]] and death. :* [[Pulmonary edema]] occurs when the pressure in blood vessels in the lung is raised because of obstruction to the removal of blood via the pulmonary veins. This is usually due to failure of the left ventricle of the heart. It can also occur in altitude sickness or on inhalation of toxic chemicals. Pulmonary edema produces shortness of breath. [[Pleural effusion]]s may occur when fluid also accumulates in the [[pleural]] cavity. :* Edema may also be found in the cornea of the eye with glaucoma, severe conjunctivitis or keratitis or after surgery. Sufferers may perceive coloured haloes around bright lights. :* Edema surrounding the eyes is called ''periorbital edema'' or [[eye puffiness]]. The periorbital tissues are most noticeably swollen immediately after waking, perhaps as a result of the gravitational redistribution of fluid in the horizontal position. :* Common appearances of [[cutaneous]] edema are observed with [[mosquito]] bites, [[spider]] bites, bee stings ([[wheal and flare]]), and skin contact with certain plants such as [[Poison Ivy]] or [[Western Poison Oak]],C.Michael Hogan (2008) [http://globaltwitcher.auderis.se/artspec_information.asp?thingid=82914 "Western poison-oak: Toxicodendron diversilobum"] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090721044257/http://globaltwitcher.auderis.se/artspec_information.asp?thingid=82914 |date=July 21, 2009 }}, GlobalTwitcher, ed. Nicklas Strömberg the latter of which are termed ''[[contact dermatitis|contact dermatitides]]''. :* Another cutaneous form of edema is [[myxedema]], which is caused by increased deposition of [[connective tissue]]. In myxedema (and a variety of other rarer conditions) edema is caused by an increased tendency of the tissue to hold water within its extracellular space. In myxedema this is because of an increase in hydrophilic carbohydrate-rich molecules (perhaps mostly [[hyaluronin]]) deposited in the tissue matrix. Edema forms more easily in dependent areas in the elderly (sitting in chairs at home or on aeroplanes) and this is not well understood. Estrogens alter body weight in part through changes in tissue water content. There may be a variety of poorly understood situations in which transfer of water from tissue matrix to lymphatics is impaired because of changes in the hydrophilicity of the tissue or failure of the 'wicking' function of terminal lymphatic capillaries. :* In [[lymphedema]] abnormal removal of interstitial fluid is caused by failure of the [[lymphatic system]]. This may be due to obstruction from, for example, pressure from a [[cancer]] or enlarged [[lymph nodes]], destruction of lymph vessels by [[radiotherapy]], or infiltration of the lymphatics by infection (such as [[Podoconiosis|elephantiasis]]). It is most commonly due to a failure of the pumping action of muscles due to immobility, most strikingly in conditions such as multiple sclerosis, or paraplegia. It has been suggested that the edema that occurs in some people following use of aspirin-like cyclo-oxygenase inhibitors such as ibuprofen or indomethacin may be due to inhibition of lymph heart action. :* [[Hydrops fetalis]] is a condition of the fetus characterized by an accumulation of fluid, or edema, in at least two fetal compartments. == Mechanism == Six factors can contribute to the formation of edema: # increased [[hydrostatic pressure]]; # reduced colloidal or [[oncotic pressure]] within blood vessels; # increased tissue colloidal or oncotic pressure; # increased blood vessel wall permeability (e.g., [[inflammation]]); # obstruction of fluid clearance in the [[lymphatic system]]; # changes in the water retaining properties of the tissues themselves. Raised hydrostatic pressure often reflects retention of water and sodium by the kidneys.{{cite book|author=Kumar|author2=Abbas|author3=Fausto |title=Pathologic Basis of Disease |edition=7th |publisher=Elsevier Saunders |year=1999 |pages=122 |isbn=0-7216-0187-1}} Generation of interstitial fluid is regulated by the forces of the [[Starling equation]].Boron W.F., Boulpaep E.L. (2012.) Medical Physiology: A Cellular and Molecular Approach, 2e. Saunders/Elsevier, Philadelphia, PA. Hydrostatic pressure within blood vessels tends to cause water to filter out into the tissue. This leads to a difference in protein concentration between blood plasma and tissue. As a result, the colloidal or [[oncotic pressure]] of the higher level of protein in the plasma tends to draw water back into the blood vessels from the tissue. Starling's equation states that the rate of leakage of fluid is determined by the difference between the two forces and also by the permeability of the vessel wall to water, which determines the rate of flow for a given force imbalance. Most water leakage occurs in capillaries or post capillary [[venule]]s, which have a [[semi-permeable membrane]] wall that allows water to pass more freely than protein. (The protein is said to be reflected and the efficiency of reflection is given by a reflection constant of up to 1.) If the gaps between the cells of the vessel wall open up then permeability to water is increased first, but as the gaps increase in size permeability to protein also increases with a fall in reflection coefficient. Changes in the variables in Starling's equation can contribute to the formation of edemas either by an increase in hydrostatic pressure within the blood vessel, a decrease in the oncotic pressure within the blood vessel or an increase in vessel wall permeability. The latter has two effects. It allows water to flow more freely and it reduces the colloidal or oncotic pressure difference by allowing protein to leave the vessel more easily. ==Treatment== {{multiple image| | image1 = Case 11-leftN.PNG | width1 = 116 | alt1 = A man with a swollen face | caption1 = Vein obstruction causes facial edema while lying down to sleep. | image2 = Case 11-rightN.png | width2 = 180 | alt2 = The same man with no swelling in his face | caption2 = After being upright all day, the swelling disappears. }} When possible, treatment involves resolving the underlying cause. Treatment may also involve positioning the affected body parts to improve drainage. For example, swelling in feet or ankles may be reduced by having the person lie down in bed or sit with the feet propped up on cushions. [[Intermittent pneumatic compression]] can be used to pressurize tissue in a limb, forcing fluids – both blood and [[lymph]] – to flow out of the pressurized area. Treatment of persistent edemas, such as [[idiopathy|idiopathic]] [[Anatomical terms of location#Medial and lateral|bilateral]] [[lymphedema]], may also use [[manual lymphatic drainage]], a low-pressure massage technique designed to pump lymphatic fluid by a similar mechanism. == Gallery == Image:Geschwollener menschlicher Fuß.JPG|Foot, c. 2 weeks post surgery because of [[compartment syndrome]] Image:MyParonychia.jpg|Left and right [[ring finger]]s of the same individual. The [[distal phalanx]] of the finger on the right exhibits edema due to [[acute paronychia]]. ==See also== * [[Water retention (medicine)]] == References == {{reflist|30em}} == External links == {{Commons category|Edema}} {{Medical condition classification and resources | DiseasesDB = 9148 | ICD10 = {{ICD10|R|60|9|r|50}} | ICD9 = {{ICD9|782.3}} | ICDO = | OMIM = | MedlinePlus = 003103 | eMedicineSubj = | eMedicineTopic = | MeshID = D004487 |}} {{Skin and subcutaneous tissue symptoms and signs}} {{Hemodynamics}} {{Authority control}} [[Category:Causes of death]] [[Category:Medical signs]] [[Category:Lymphatic vessel diseases]]

{{Infobox Wrestling event |name=Final Burning in Budokan |image=Final Burning in Budokan.jpg |caption=Promotional poster for the event, featuring [[Kenta Kobashi]] pictured with the [[Triple Crown Heavyweight Championship]] belts (left) and the [[GHC Heavyweight Championship]] belt (right) |tagline={{nihongo||小橋建太引退記念試合|Kobashi Kenta Intai Kinen Shiai}} |promotion=[[Pro Wrestling Noah]] |date={{dts|2013|05|11}}<ref name=FinalBurninginBudokan/> |venue=[[Nippon Budokan]]<ref name=FinalBurninginBudokan/> |city=[[Tokyo]], Japan<ref name=FinalBurninginBudokan/> |attendance=17,000<ref name=FinalBurninginBudokan/><ref name=Observer/> |lastevent=[[All Together (professional wrestling)#Sendai|All Together: Mōikkai, Hitotsu ni Narō ze]] |nextevent= }} '''Final Burning in Budokan''' was a [[professional wrestling]] [[pay-per-view]] (PPV) event promoted by [[Pro Wrestling Noah]], which took place on May 11, 2013, at [[Nippon Budokan]] in [[Tokyo]], Japan. Headlined by the retirement match of [[Kenta Kobashi]], all in all, the event featured seven matches and wrestlers from not only Noah, but also [[All Japan Pro Wrestling]] (AJPW), [[Diamond Ring (professional wrestling)|Diamond Ring]], [[New Japan Pro-Wrestling]] (NJPW) and [[Tenryu Project]].<ref name=FinalBurninginBudokan/> Due to Kobashi's high-profile status in the history of Japanese professional wrestling, the event gained mainstream attention in the country. [[Dave Meltzer]] of the ''[[Wrestling Observer Newsletter]]'' called the event the "end of an era in Japanese pro wrestling", drawing parallels to [[Pelé]]'s 1977 retirement from [[soccer]].<ref name=Observer/>
==Production== ===Background=== [[File:LEGEND....jpg|thumb|upright|left|[[Kenta Kobashi]] in November 2007]] On December 3, 2012, the ''[[Tokyo Sports]]'' newspaper reported that [[Pro Wrestling Noah]] had decided to terminate the contract of veteran wrestler [[Kenta Kobashi]] due to financial issues.<ref name=Observer>{{cite magazine | last = Meltzer | first = Dave | authorlink = Dave Meltzer | date = May 21, 2013 | title = May 21 2013 Wrestling Observer Newsletter: Kenta Kobashi retirement and career history, Budokan Hall history, WWE annual directory, tons more, second issue of the week | magazine = [[Wrestling Observer Newsletter]] | location = [[Campbell, California]] | issn = 1083-9593 | pages=1–17}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.tokyo-sports.co.jp/prores/60055/ | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20121210174908/http://www.tokyo-sports.co.jp/prores/60055/ | script-title=ja:ノア激震！小橋解雇、秋山ら退団 | archivedate=December 10, 2012 | date=December 4, 2012 | accessdate=September 20, 2017 | work=[[Tokyo Sports]] | language=Japanese}}</ref> Kobashi had been with Noah since its inception in 2000 and had been the reigning [[All Japan Pro Wrestling]] (AJPW) [[Triple Crown Heavyweight Champion]], when he left AJPW to follow [[Mitsuharu Misawa]] to the newly-created promotion.<ref name=Observer/> Kobashi then became the catalyst in a period, where Noah enjoyed great success with [[Nippon Budokan]] sellouts and classic matches.<ref name=Observer/> At a time when [[mixed martial arts]] was doing strong business in Japan and professional wrestling was seen as the "old fake version", Kobashi's drawing power kept Noah the most popular professional wrestling promotion in the country.<ref name=Observer/> However, while the promotion had once been considered one of the best in the world, it had recently fallen on hard times.<ref name=Observer/> First Kobashi started suffering from various injuries, which quickly took a toll on Noah's popularity.<ref name=Observer/> Kobashi's hard hitting style meant that by the age of 24, his knees were described as being "thrashed" and by the age of 33, he had had more than a dozen operations. Kobashi also battled [[kidney cancer]], which sidelined him for 17 months in early 2006.<ref name=Observer/> None of the wrestlers designed to replace Kobashi at the top of Noah had his charisma or drawing power and eventually the promotion lost its network television contract.<ref name=Observer/> Following Misawa's death in the ring in 2009, the promotion started to unravel with financial issues and dissension in the front office.<ref name=Observer/> Despite not having wrestled in almost a year, Kobashi was the highest paid worker in Noah and by December 2012 the company simply could no longer afford him.<ref name=Observer/>
[[File:Jun Akiyama.jpg|thumb|upright|left|[[Jun Akiyama]] was one of five wrestlers to resign from Noah after the company decided to terminate Kobashi's contract]] Noah's decision to cut Kobashi led to an immediate backlash from wrestlers loyal to him with [[Atsushi Aoki]], [[Go Shiozaki]], [[Jun Akiyama]], [[Kotaro Suzuki]] and [[Yoshinobu Kanemaru]] announcing their resignation from the promotion.<ref name=Observer/><ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.tokyo-sports.co.jp/prores/60607/ | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20130611051029/http://www.tokyo-sports.co.jp/prores/60607/ | script-title=ja:主力大量離脱ノアの今後 | archivedate=June 11, 2013 | date=December 7, 2012 | accessdate=September 20, 2017 | work=[[Tokyo Sports]] | language=Japanese}}</ref> The five ended up joining AJPW after their contracts with Noah expired at the end of the year,<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.nikkansports.com/battle/news/p-bt-tp0-20121219-1061517.html | script-title=ja:秋山らノア退団正式決定 | date=December 19, 2012 | accessdate=September 20, 2017 | work=[[Nikkan Sports]] | language=Japanese}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.nikkansports.com/battle/news/p-bt-tp0-20130127-1077224.html | script-title=ja:ノア退団の秋山ら５人が参戦へ／全日本 | date=January 27, 2013 | accessdate=September 20, 2017 | work=[[Nikkan Sports]] | language=Japanese}}</ref> forming a new version of the [[Burning (professional wrestling)|Burning]] [[Glossary of professional wrestling terms#stable|stable]], which had originally been formed by Kobashi and Akiyama in 1998.<ref name=Burning/>
On December 9, 2012, Kobashi appeared at Noah's [[Ryōgoku Kokugikan]] event, announcing his retirement from professional wrestling, having deemed it impossible to fully recover from the accumulation of his injuries. Stating that he wanted to wrestle one final match, Kobashi added that he was not being forced to retire.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.noah.co.jp/news_detail.php?news_id=4682 | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20121214015043/http://www.noah.co.jp/news_detail.php?news_id=4682 | script-title=ja:「Great Voyage 2012 in Ryogoku vol.2」12月9日(日)両国国技館大会 小橋建太選手コメント | archivedate=December 14, 2012 | date=December 9, 2012 | accessdate=September 20, 2017 | work=[[Pro Wrestling Noah]] | language=Japanese}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.f4wonline.com/more/more-top-stories/118-daily-updates/28758-kobashi-announces-retirement | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20121211194717/http://www.f4wonline.com/more/more-top-stories/118-daily-updates/28758-kobashi-announces-retirement | title = Kobashi announces retirement | archivedate=December 11, 2012 | date=December 9, 2012 | accessdate=September 20, 2017 | work=[[Wrestling Observer Newsletter]]}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/Other_News_4/article_67103.shtml | title = Japan news: Legendary Kobashi announces retirement | last=Caldwell | first=James | date=December 9, 2012 | accessdate=September 20, 2017 | work=Pro Wrestling Torch}}</ref> Originally Kobashi planned to have his retirement match on February 26, 2013, which would have been the 25th anniversary of his debut, but quickly realized he needed more time to get into ring shape, which led to the date being pushed back to May 11, 2013.<ref name=Observer/> The date was confirmed on January 23,<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.nikkansports.com/battle/news/p-bt-tp0-20130511-1125430.html | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20130607122207/http://www.nikkansports.com/battle/news/p-bt-tp0-20130511-1125430.html | script-title=ja:武道館１万7000人が最後の小橋を見届ける | archivedate=June 7, 2013 | date=May 11, 2013 | accessdate=September 20, 2017 | work=[[Nikkan Sports]] | language=Japanese}}</ref> and on March 31, it was announced that Kobashi's retirement match would be an eight-man tag team match, where he, Jun Akiyama, [[Keiji Mutoh]] and [[Kensuke Sasaki]] would take on Go Shiozaki, [[Kenta Kobayashi|Kenta]], [[Maybach Taniguchi]] and Yoshinobu Kanemaru.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/Other_News_4/article_69634.shtml | title = Japan news: Details on Kenta Kobashi's retirement match | date=March 31, 2013 | accessdate=September 20, 2017 | work=Pro Wrestling Torch}}</ref> Out of his partners, Kobashi was particularly close to Akiyama, with the history between the two dating back 20 years to their junior days in AJPW.<ref name=Burning>{{cite web | url = http://www.nikkansports.com/battle/news/p-bt-tp0-20130512-1125970.html | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20130607181106/http://www.nikkansports.com/battle/news/p-bt-tp0-20130512-1125970.html | script-title=ja:秋山の誓い！小橋の思いを引き継ぐ／ノア | archivedate=June 7, 2013 | date=May 12, 2013 | accessdate=September 20, 2017 | work=[[Nikkan Sports]] | language=Japanese}}</ref> The entire team opposing Kobashi was made up of his protégés.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.f4wonline.com/more/more-top-stories/118-daily-updates/31222-notes-on-kenta-kobashi-retirement-match | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20130609015222/http://www.f4wonline.com/more/more-top-stories/118-daily-updates/31222-notes-on-kenta-kobashi-retirement-match | title = Notes on Kenta Kobashi retirement match | archivedate=June 9, 2013 | date=May 11, 2013 | accessdate=September 20, 2017 | work=[[Wrestling Observer Newsletter]]}}</ref> [[Tokyo]]'s Nippon Budokan was chosen as the arena for the show. Despite Noah's recent difficulties, it was considered a "given" that the promotion could sell out Nippon Budokan for the show, while [[Tokyo Dome]] was deemed "too big of a risk".<ref name=Observer/> Kobashi also had significant history with Nippon Budokan. Big matches in his early career as well as his tag team tournament and Triple Crown Heavyweight Championship wins had taken place in the arena and during his two-year run as the [[GHC Heavyweight Champion]], Noah held its big shows in the arena.<ref name=Observer/>
[[File:Yoshihiko Noda-3.jpg|thumb|upright|[[Yoshihiko Noda]], the former [[Prime Minister of Japan]] and a self-professed fan of Kobashi, attended the event]] Kobashi's retirement event received significant coverage in mainstream media in Japan.<ref name=Observer/> Several magazines ran special editions dedicated entirely to Kobashi.<ref name=Observer/> The event was streamed into movie theaters across Japan. Every theater in [[Tokyo]] was sold out, most well ahead of time.<ref name=Observer/> Japan's former prime minister [[Yoshihiko Noda]], who had stated that Kobashi was his favorite wrestler, announced that he would attend the event.<ref name=Observer/><ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.nikkansports.com/battle/news/p-bt-tp0-20130509-1124409.html | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20130516233534/http://www.nikkansports.com/battle/news/p-bt-tp0-20130509-1124409.html | script-title=ja:小橋「ありがたい」野田前首相の来場 | archivedate=May 16, 2013 | date=May 9, 2013 | accessdate=September 20, 2017 | work=[[Nikkan Sports]] | language=Japanese}}</ref>
Kobashi trained for the match at the Pro Wrestling Noah dojo, where he had trained since the promotion's founding in 2000. He would enter his final match weighing {{convert|105|kg|lb|abbr=on}}.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.nikkansports.com/battle/news/p-bt-tp0-20130511-1125428.html | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20130607181101/http://www.nikkansports.com/battle/news/p-bt-tp0-20130511-1125428.html | script-title=ja:小橋きょう引退！リングで25年の集大成を | archivedate=June 7, 2013 | date=May 11, 2013 | accessdate=September 20, 2017 | work=[[Nikkan Sports]] | language=Japanese}}</ref> This would mark his first match in 455 days.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.nikkansports.com/battle/news/f-bt-tp0-20130512-1125833.html | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20130607114116/http://www.nikkansports.com/battle/news/f-bt-tp0-20130512-1125833.html | script-title=ja:引退小橋455日ぶり有終星「感謝」／ノア | archivedate=June 7, 2013 | date=May 12, 2013 | accessdate=September 20, 2017 | work=[[Nikkan Sports]] | language=Japanese}}</ref>
==Event== The show was opened by an appearance by [[Hayabusa (wrestler)|Hayabusa]], who had been paralyzed in the ring in 2001. With help from crutches, he walked to the ring and talked about taking a [[Professional wrestling attacks#Lariat|lariat]] from Kobashi in Nippon Budokan.<ref name=Observer/>
In the opening match of the show, [[Masanobu Fuchi]] defeated [[Hitoshi Kumano]] with the [[Suplex#Belly-to-back suplex|backdrop]].<ref name=FinalBurninginBudokan/> Fuchi was one of Kobashi's original trainers and the match was designed to show him now, a generation later, training the recently debuted Kumano.<ref name=Observer/>
In the second match, [[Atsushi Kotoge]] and [[Taiji Ishimori]] took on [[Genba Hirayanagi]] and [[Takahiro Suwa|Suwa]]. During the match, former prime minister Yoshihiko Noda, who was seated in the front row, took part in a spot, where Hirayanagi recreated a spit spot made famous by [[Haruka Eigen]]. During the match, Suwa suffered a spinal injury and was stretchered out of the arena, after Ishimori pinned Hirayanagi with the [[Professional wrestling aerial techniques#450° splash|450° splash]] to end the match.<ref name=Observer/>
The third match featured Atsushi Aoki and Kotaro Suzuki facing [[Kentaro Shiga]] and [[Tamon Honda]]. Aoki and Suzuki had quit Noah in protest over Kobashi's treatment and were now representing AJPW. Honda was Kobashi's training partner for years and at one point his regular tag team partner.<ref name=Observer/> The match was billed as "Burning vs. Burning", with Aoki and Suzuki being part of the new Burning stable in AJPW, while Shiga and Honda had been part of the earlier version of the group.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://live.sportsnavi.yahoo.co.jp/live/fight/all/2013051101/detail/5 | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20130627162541/http://live.sportsnavi.yahoo.co.jp/live/fight/all/2013051101/detail/5 | script-title=ja:Final Burning in Budokan 小橋建太引退記念試合 | archivedate=June 27, 2013 | date=May 11, 2013 | accessdate=September 20, 2017 | work=Sports Navi | publisher=[[Yahoo!]] | language=Japanese}}</ref> Aoki and Suzuki won the match with Suzuki pinning Shiga for the win with the ''Endless Waltz''.<ref name=FinalBurninginBudokan/>
After the third match, Kobashi came out to the ring for his retirement ceremony, which was also attended by wrestlers [[Akira Taue]], [[Hiroshi Hase]], [[Masahiro Chono]], [[Masanobu Fuchi]], [[Mitsuo Momota]], [[Takeshi Rikio]] and [[Toshiaki Kawada]] as well as [[Asuka Kuramochi]] from [[AKB48]] and Yoshihiko Noda among others. The ceremony also included a written statement from [[John Laurinaitis]], Kobashi's on-and-off tag team partner in the 90s, and a pre-taped promo from [[Stan Hansen]].<ref name=Observer/><ref>{{cite web | url = https://www.tokyo-sports.co.jp/prores/mens_prores/142177/ | script-title=ja:小橋引退に川田も駆けつけた | date=May 12, 2013 | accessdate=September 20, 2017 | work=[[Tokyo Sports]] | language=Japanese}}</ref>
The fourth match of the show saw [[Genichiro Tenryu]] and [[Yoshinari Ogawa]] defeat [[Masao Inoue]] and [[Takeshi Morishima]].<ref name=Observer/>
The fifth match featured the [[New Japan Pro-Wrestling]] (NJPW) trio of [[Hiroshi Tanahashi]], [[Satoshi Kojima]] and [[Yuji Nagata]] taking on the Noah trio of [[Akitoshi Saito]], [[Muhammad Yone]] and [[Takashi Sugiura]]. The NJPW wrestlers, Tanahashi in particular, were booed by the Noah crowd. Tanahashi won the match for his team by pinning Saito with the ''[[Professional wrestling aerial techniques#Frog splash|High Fly Flow]]''.<ref name=Observer/>
[[File:KENTA2.jpg|thumb|upright|Kobashi's protégé [[Kenta Kobayashi|Kenta]], the reigning [[GHC Heavyweight Champion]], took part in the main event]] The sixth match featured the reunion of [[No Fear (professional wrestling)|No Fear]] as [[Takao Omori]] and [[Yoshihiro Takayama]], who had teamed together in both AJPW and Noah, took on [[Minoru Suzuki]] and [[Naomichi Marufuji]]. No Fear won the match with Takayama pinning Marufuji with the ''[[Suplex#German suplex|Everest German Suplex Hold]]''.<ref name=FinalBurninginBudokan/><ref name=Observer/><ref>{{cite web | url = https://www.tokyo-sports.co.jp/prores/mens_prores/142225/ | script-title=ja:ノーフィアー２年ぶり復活「チャンスをくれたのは小橋」 | date=May 12, 2013 | accessdate=September 20, 2017 | work=[[Tokyo Sports]] | language=Japanese}}</ref>
The main event of the show was the retirement match of Kenta Kobashi, where he teamed with Jun Akiyama, Keiji Mutoh and Kensuke Sasaki to take on Go Shiozaki, Kenta, Maybach Taniguchi and Yoshinobu Kanemaru. Kobashi came to the ring wearing an old version of the GHC Heavyweight Championship belt. He had not actually held the title since 2005, but was considered both the greatest champion in the title's history as well as the man most synonymous with the title, nicknamed the {{nihongo|"Absolute Champion"|絶対王者|zettai ōja}}. The match featured Kobashi doing several of his signature moves, including the ''[[Professional wrestling holds#Abdominal stretch|Cobra Twist]]'', [[Suplex#Half nelson suplex|half nelson suplex]], [[Pin (professional wrestling)#Cradle|rolling cradle]] and 187 [[Professional wrestling attacks#Backhand chop|chops]]. At the end, he hit Kanemaru with a [[Suplex#Superplex|superplex]] and a lariat, but his pin attempt was broken up by Kanemaru's partners. Akiyama then hit Taniguchi with an [[Suplex#Exploder suplex|exploder suplex]] and Sasaki hit a German suplex on Kenta, while Mutoh hit a [[backbreaker]] and a [[moonsault]] on Kanemaru. Akiyama, Mutoh and Sasaki then all signaled for Kobashi, who hit a [[Professional wrestling throws#Body slam|body slam]] on Kanemaru and then climbed the ropes for the final moonsault of his career, which won the match for his team.<ref name=Observer/><ref>{{cite web | url = https://www.tokyo-sports.co.jp/prores/142086/ | script-title=ja:プロレスラー小橋建太｢ラストマッチ｣で奇跡の月面水爆 | date=May 12, 2013 | accessdate=September 20, 2017 | work=[[Tokyo Sports]] | language=Japanese}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.nikkansports.com/battle/news/p-bt-tp0-20130512-1125965.html | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20130607202751/http://www.nikkansports.com/battle/news/p-bt-tp0-20130512-1125965.html | script-title=ja:小橋“魂の187発”で現役に別れ／ノア | archivedate=June 7, 2013 | date=May 12, 2013 | accessdate=September 20, 2017 | work=[[Nikkan Sports]] | language=Japanese}}</ref>
After the conclusion of the match, the ring and ringside area were filled with wrestlers. Kobashi's wife and mother also came to the ring for his retirement speech. After a [[ten-bell salute]] to signal the end of Kobashi's career, his greatest accomplishments were read out loud after which the event concluded with his theme song "Grand Sword" being played in Nippon Budokan.<ref name=Observer/><ref>{{cite web | url = http://battle-news.com/battle/2013/05/001811.php | script-title=ja:やはり小橋は最後まで"鉄人"だった！まさかの月面水爆で引退試合を締めくくった小橋「プロレスは自分の青春でした」 | date=May 11, 2013 | accessdate=September 20, 2017 | work=Battle News | language=Japanese}}</ref>
==Aftermath== In June 2014, Kobashi started producing his own independent events under the banner of "Fortune Dream". In addition to putting together the cards, featuring wrestlers from multiple promotions, Kobashi would participate in the shows in sit-down interview segments with fellow veteran wrestlers, including Genichiro Tenryu and [[Riki Choshu]].<ref>{{cite web | url = https://www.tokyo-sports.co.jp/prores/mens_prores/275452/ | script-title=ja:初プロデュース興行成功の小橋が秋山に協力約束 | date=June 9, 2014 | accessdate=September 20, 2017 | work=[[Tokyo Sports]] | language=Japanese}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url = https://www.tokyo-sports.co.jp/prores/mens_prores/344314/ | script-title=ja:＜小橋興行＞天龍の復帰要請に鉄人たじたじ | date=December 11, 2014 | accessdate=September 20, 2017 | work=[[Tokyo Sports]] | language=Japanese}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url = https://www.tokyo-sports.co.jp/prores/mens_prores/553182/ | script-title=ja:三沢さんの命日翌日にプロデュース興行 小橋の思い | date=June 15, 2016 | accessdate=September 20, 2017 | work=[[Tokyo Sports]] | language=Japanese}}</ref>
By the end of 2015, Go Shiozaki, Kotaro Suzuki and Yoshinobu Kanemaru, three of the five wrestlers who had quit Noah in protest, had quit AJPW.<ref>{{cite web | url = https://www.tokyo-sports.co.jp/prores/mens_prores/474565/ | script-title=ja:全日プロ激震！今度は金丸が退団 | date=November 20, 2015 | accessdate=September 20, 2017 | work=[[Tokyo Sports]] | language=Japanese}}</ref> Shiozaki and Kanemaru quickly returned to Noah,<ref>{{cite web | url = https://www.tokyo-sports.co.jp/prores/mens_prores/493178/ | script-title=ja:潮﨑＆金丸の「元全日コンビ」白星発進も鈴木軍に一喝され… | date=January 10, 2016 | accessdate=September 20, 2017 | work=[[Tokyo Sports]] | language=Japanese}}</ref> with Shiozaki re-signing with the promotion in June 2016.<ref>{{cite web | url = https://www.tokyo-sports.co.jp/prores/mens_prores/552564/ | script-title=ja:ノア再入団の潮崎が会見 方舟マットを「もっと高みに導きたい」 | date=June 13, 2016 | accessdate=September 20, 2017 | work=[[Tokyo Sports]] | language=Japanese}}</ref> Akiyama and Aoki remain in AJPW,<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.all-japan.co.jp/player/秋山準 | script-title=ja:秋山 準 | accessdate=September 20, 2017 | work=[[All Japan Pro Wrestling]] | language=Japanese}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.all-japan.co.jp/player/青木篤志 | script-title=ja:青木 篤志 | accessdate=September 20, 2017 | work=[[All Japan Pro Wrestling]] | language=Japanese}}</ref> with Akiyama having taken over as the promotion's president in July 2014.<ref>{{cite web | url = https://www.tokyo-sports.co.jp/prores/mens_prores/273706/ | script-title=ja:全日本プロレス激震！秋山新社長で再出発へ | date=June 4, 2014 | accessdate=September 20, 2017 | work=[[Tokyo Sports]] | language=Japanese}}</ref>
Kensuke Sasaki, one of the veteran wrestlers who had teamed with Kobashi in the main event of the show, announced his retirement on February 13, 2014. Unlike Kobashi, Sasaki decided against doing a retirement match,<ref>{{cite web | url = https://www.tokyo-sports.co.jp/prores/mens_prores/553185/ | script-title=ja:健介が引退後初リング 小橋とトークバトル | date=June 15, 2016 | accessdate=September 20, 2017 | work=[[Tokyo Sports]] | language=Japanese}}</ref> with his final match having already taken place two days earlier.<ref>{{cite web | url = https://www.tokyo-sports.co.jp/prores/mens_prores/234831/ | script-title=ja:「引退」佐々木健介はプロレス界と完全決別 | date=February 14, 2014 | accessdate=September 20, 2017 | work=[[Tokyo Sports]] | language=Japanese}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.f4wonline.com/more/more-top-stories/102-japan/35419-2013-hall-of-famer-announces-retirement | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20140301184349/http://www.f4wonline.com/more/more-top-stories/102-japan/35419-2013-hall-of-famer-announces-retirement | title = 2013 Hall of Famer announces retirement | last=Meltzer | first=Dave | authorlink=Dave Meltzer | archivedate=March 1, 2014 | date=February 13, 2014 | accessdate=September 20, 2017 | work=[[Wrestling Observer Newsletter]]}}</ref>

{{EngvarB|date=October 2017}} {{Use dmy dates|date=October 2017}} {{Infobox recurring event | name = G-A-Y | logo = G-A-Y_London_Club_logo.jpg | logo_alt = | logo_caption = | logo_size = | image = | image_size = | alt = | caption = | status = Active | genre = Night club | frequency = | location = [[London]], England | coordinates = | years_active = {{age|1976|0|0|df=y}} years | first = | founder_name = | last = | next = | participants = | attendance = | capacity = | area = | budget = | activity = | leader_name = | patron = | organised = | filing = | people = | member = | sponsor = | website = {{URL|http://www.g-a-y.co.uk/}} | footnotes = }}
'''G-A-Y''' is a long-running gay [[nightclub]], based at [[Heaven (nightclub)|Heaven]] in [[Charing Cross]], [[London]]. It originally started in 1976, and for many years was based at the [[London Astoria]].
==History== G-A-Y originally began in 1976 in the Sundown club in the basement of the [[London Astoria]] (later LA2) as a Monday night event called ''Bang!''. It was started by club promoters Norman Scott, Damien Tony and Jerry Collins, who worked as a DJ under the name Gary London. During the 1980s, ''Bang!'' (which had by then also expanded to Saturday night) and ''Propaganda'' (Thursday night) were run by gay club promoter and DJ Colin Peters (Peter Daubeney), whose brother Jamie continued as promoter for a period following his death. In the early 1990s, ''Bang!'' was acquired by DJ and promoter Jeremy Joseph who was formerly employed by Peters, who oversaw its change of name to ''G-A-Y''. At this point, G-A-Y expanded further from two nights a week to four - hosting at the LA2 on Mondays and Thursdays and the London Astoria on Fridays and Saturdays.
It operated from the [[London Astoria]] music venue for 15 years until July 2008. The [[Boston Globe]] described it as "London's largest gay-themed club night",<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.boston.com/travel/articles/2004/04/28/london_has_hot_tickets_big_hair_and_a_club_night_for_every_taste/ | title= London has hot tickets, big hair, and a club night for every taste|date=28 April 2004|work=Boston Globe online}}</ref> ''[[NME]]'' reported that it "attracts 6,000 clubbers each week",<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nme.com/news/all-saints/3606 |title=Sing If You'Re Glad To Be at G.A.Y. |work=NME |date=19 June 2000 |accessdate=3 May 2009}}</ref> and ''[[The Independent]]'' described it as "the one London gig that really matters" for "today's pop stars".<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/music/features/why-theyre-all-glad-to-be-gay-584844.html |title=Why they're all glad to be G-A-Y |work=[[The Independent]] |date=28 October 2003 |accessdate=3 May 2009 | location=London}}</ref>
G-A-Y is associated with ''G-A-Y Bar'' and ''G-A-Y Late''. A major stake in the brand was bought on 13 August 2007 by the [[MAMA Group]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.pinknews.co.uk/2007/08/13/music-group-buys-into-g-a-y-bars/ |title=Music group buys into G-A-Y bars |publisher=PinkNews.co.uk |date=13 August 2007 |accessdate=3 May 2009}}</ref> On Friday 3 October 2008, G-A-Y moved to famous gay venue [[Heaven (nightclub)|Heaven]], which MAMA Group has acquired a few weeks earlier on 22 September 2008.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.pinknews.co.uk/2008/09/25/mama-group-delighted-at-acquisition-of-heaven/ | title =MAMA Group “delighted” at acquisition of Heaven | date= 25 September 2008 | work= PinkNews.co.uk}}</ref>
==The G-A-Y Album== {{Main|G-A-Y (album)}} In 2000, a 40 track compilation album was released, featuring songs from some of the artists who had appeared at G-A-Y. A promotional campaign took place in the weeks leading up to release, including television and radio advertisements, a nationwide poster campaign and magazine advertisements in both the gay and teen press{{Citation needed|date=March 2009}}.
On Saturday 1 July 2000, a show was held at G-A-Y to promote the release of the album. Seven acts who appeared on the album performed. These acts were [[Shola Ama]], [[All Saints (group)|All Saints]], [[Bananarama]], [[Dina Carroll]], [[Billie Piper]], [[Honeyz]] and [[Louise Redknapp|Louise]]. Each act performed only one song, apart from [[Louise Redknapp|Louise]], who also performed her new single "2 Faced".
The G-A-Y album was released on Monday 3 July 2000 and peaked at number 18 in the UK compilations chart{{Citation needed|date=March 2009}}.
==G-A-Y Brand== The G-A-Y brand has expanded to two other bars in the area. G-A-Y Late (located near the former Astoria site) and G-A-Y bar (located nearby in [[Soho (London)|Soho's]] [[Old Compton Street]]). In April 2011, the G-A-Y brand arrived on Manchester's iconic [[Canal Street (Manchester)|Canal Street]] with a G-A-Y bar opening in the former venue of Spirit Bar.<ref>{{cite web|title=GAY Website|url=http://www.g-a-y.co.uk/Manchester/index.htm|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110804025130/http://www.g-a-y.co.uk/Manchester/index.htm|archivedate=4 August 2011|df=dmy-all}}</ref> The brand is now 100% owned by Jeremy Joseph.<ref> {{cite web |url=http://www.pinknews.co.uk/news/articles/2005-5170.html |title=Music group buys into G-A-Y bars |publisher=Pink News |accessdate=11 April 2009 |author=Tony Grew |date=13 August 2007 }} </ref>
== Performances == <!-- ANY ADDITIONS TO THIS SECTION SHOULD BE PROPERLY CITED, OTHERWISE THEY WILL BE REMOVED --> Saturday nights at G-A-Y/Heaven have seen many performances from a wide selection of artists and genres. Acts to have appeared in the G-A-Y/Heaven include: {{Div col|colwidth=22em}} *[[Alesha Dixon]]<ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.thesun.co.uk/sol/homepage/showbiz/bizarre/1913023/Alesha-Dixon-looks-hot-in-sexy-catsuit-at-GAY.html | location=London | work=The Sun | title=Alesha purrs in sexy catsuit | date=10 November 2008}}</ref> *[[Anastacia]]<ref>{{cite news| url=https://gaypers.com/event/ANASTACIA-G-A-Y-66466 | location=London | work=Gaypers | title=Resurrecting at G-A-Y | date=2 August 2014}}</ref> *[[B*Witched]]<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.qxmagazine.com/club-night/g-a-y-divas-album-launch-with-bwitched-g-a-y/ |title=G-A-Y Divas Album Launch with B*Witched @ G-A-Y |date=8 October 2014 |work=[[QX (British magazine)|QX]] |access-date=8 October 2015}}</ref> *[[Britney Spears]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://brit-s.net/111563/britney-spears-partying-at-g-a-y-nightclub-in-london/ |title=Britney Spears partying at G-A-Y Nightclub in London |publisher=Brit-s.net |date=30 November 2008 |accessdate=3 May 2009}}</ref> *[[Ellie Goulding]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.glamourmagazine.co.uk/article/ellie-goulding-niall-horan-gay-gig-london|title=Back on? Niall Horan cheers Ellie Goulding on at G.A.Y gig|publisher=Glamour|date=18 November 2003|accessdate=22 March 2018}}</ref> *[[Fifth Harmony]] *[[Kylie Minogue]] *[[Lady Gaga]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.gigwise.com/news/48777/Lady-GaGa-Storms-G-A-Y-In-London|title=Lady GaGa storms G-A-Y in London|publisher=Gigwise|date=17 January 2009|accessdate=9 December 2010}}</ref> *[[Little Mix]] *[[Madonna (entertainer)|Madonna]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.gettyimages.co.uk/event/madonna-plays-g-a-y-at-astoria-56221102#pop-star-madonna-performs-live-at-weekly-gay-night-gay-promoting-her-picture-id56245111|title=Madonna Plays G-A-Y at Astoria – Getty Images|accessdate=24 October 2016}}</ref> *[[Marina and the Diamonds]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.gettyimages.com/photos/marina-diamandis?excludenudity=false&family=editorial&events=142927549&page=1&phrase=marina%20diamandis&photographer=undefined&sort=best|title=Marina Diamandis Pictures And Photos – Getty Images|accessdate=20 June 2016}}</ref> *[[McFly]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.viewlondon.co.uk/whatson/mcfly-at-g-a-y-article-5284.html|title=Check out McFly at G-A-Y on View. For further info, reviews, tickets and to see what's on.|accessdate=20 June 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://popdirt.com/mcfly-get-naked-at-g-a-y/50785/|title=McFly Get Naked at G-A-Y |accessdate=20 June 2016}}</ref> *[[Olly Murs]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.capitalfm.com/artists/olly-murs/photos/olly-murs-at-gay/|title=Olly Murs at G-A-Y|accessdate=3 June 2017}}</ref> *[[One Direction]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.qxmagazine.com/club-night/one-direction-g-a-y/|title=One Direction @ G-A-Y|publisher=QX Magazine|date=17 Sep 2011|accessdate=19 Jan 2018}}</ref> *[[The Human League]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.the-black-hit-of-space.dk/concerts.htm|title=THE HUMAN LEAGUE|accessdate=20 June 2016}}</ref> *[[Steps (pop group)|Steps]] {{div col end}}

{{Infobox Convention | name = Intervention | image = [[Image:interventionlogo.gif|100px]] | caption = Intervention logo | status = Defunct | genre = Internet Culture | venue = Hilton Rockville/Washington D.C. | location = Rockville, Maryland | country = United States | first = 2010 | last = | organizer = Onezumi Events Inc. | attendance = 905 in 2013 | website = http://www.interventioncon.com }}
'''Intervention''' is a yearly [[Internet culture|Internet Culture]] convention held in September in Rockville Maryland at the Hilton Rockville/Washington D.C. hotel.<ref name="INT2010-location">{{cite web | url = http://www.interventioncon.com/location | title = Intervention web site | accessdate = 2010-12-08 | publisher = intervention}}</ref> Intervention (a combination of the words "Internet" and "Convention")<ref name="INT2010-contact">{{cite web | url = http://www.interventioncon.com/contact | title = Intervention web site | accessdate = 2010-12-08 | publisher = intervention}}</ref> highlights independent artists from all spectrums of creative output (Comics, Music, Video, Blogging, Stories, etc.) who use the Internet as their primary distribution method. The convention hosts panels, workshops, movie showings, music concerts, open gaming, and dance events.
==Notable Guests== Notable guests of Intervention 2010 include Phil “Frumph” Hofer, lead programmer of ComicPress, the premiere web-comic publishing front-end on the Internet; cartoonist [[Brad Guigar]], creator of “Evil, Inc.” a syndicated strip which appears both online and in front of 1.5 million newspaper readers; artist/writer [[Fred Gallagher (cartoonist)|Fred Gallagher]], who created the widely successful webcomic “[[Megatokyo]]”, the collections of which are ranked by Nielsen Bookscan as one of the best-selling Original English-language Manga on shelves; and artist [[Molly Crabapple]], creator of the graphic novel ''Scarlett Takes Manhattan'' and founder of [[Dr Sketchy's Anti-Art School]], which has branches in over 100 cities across the world.
In all over 40+ professional artists were guests at the 2010 convention and participated in panels and workshops.<ref name="INT2010-guests">{{cite web | url = http://interventioncon.com/2010/guests/ | title = Intervention web site | accessdate = 2010-12-08 | publisher = intervention}}</ref>
New Notable guest of Intervention 2011 include [[Shaenon K. Garrity]] and Jeffrey Wells of the webcomic Skin Horse; Jennie Breeden of the webcomic The Devil's Panties; Becky Harks of the blog Mommywantsvodka.com; Carrie Gouldin, Web Community Manager for thinkgeek.com; and Christopher Baldwin of the webcomic Spacetrawler. In addition Intervention began a Children's Programming track in conjunction with members of Wired.com's GeekDad and GeekMom blog (Matt Blum, Brian and Helene McLaughlin). A live music/performance track was also started with the musical acts Eien Strife, The Tombstone Teeth, Mark Aaron James, Blue, The FuMP, and DJ Dave Ghoul; and with performances by the dance troop Antipode, Cosplay Burlesque, and [[Super Art Fight]].
In all over 50+ professional artists and performers were guests at the 2011 convention and participated in panels and workshops.<ref name="INT2011-guests" />
==Press and Discussions of The Convention== *[http://www.cvcomics.com/artandstory/?p=1136 Art & Story: Episode 145 – The Big Intervention] *[http://boingboing.net/2013/07/05/come-to-intervention-2013-aug.html Boing Boing - Come to Intervention 2013, Aug 23-25, Rockville MD] *[https://web.archive.org/web/20100919084614/http://charmcitycurrent.com/bmorenerdy/2010/08/17/giving-the-internet-an-intervention-a-qa-with-onezumi/ Charm City Current: Giving the Internet An INTERVENTION: A Q&A With Onezumi] *[http://comixtalk.com/meeting_aa_during_intervention_doesnt_mean_what_you_think ComixTalk: Meeting in AA During Intervention Doesn’t Mean What You Think] *[http://www.geekingoutabout.com/2010/06/22/comic-non-sans-intervention/ Geeking Out About--Comic Non Sans: Intervention] *[http://manvsart.com/man-vs-art-episode-29-don-bluth-interview-pt-2-plus-webcomic-diva-onezumi-hartstein/ Man vs. Art:Episode 29] *[http://otakugeneration.libsyn.com/otaku_generation_show_273_intervention_con Otaku Generation: Show #273] *[http://www.otakuusamagazine.com/Podcast/News1/Friday_ACE_Episode_24_81310_3346.aspx Otaku USA Magazine: Friday ACE Episode 24] *[http://www.shrinkgeek.com/2010/08/19/ceo-flavored-insanity-an-interview-with-onezumi/ ShrinkGeek: CEO-flavored insanity: An interview with Onezumi] *[http://tgtwebcomics.com/podcast/ep115-interventioncon/ Two Guys Talking Webcomics:TGT Webcomics Podcast – Episode 115] *[http://www.washingtoncitypaper.com/blogs/artsdesk/books/2010/09/03/meet-a-local-con-organizer-a-chat-with-onezumi-hartstein-of-intervention/ Washington City Paper: Interview with Onezumi about Intervention] *[http://www.webcomicalliance.com/conventions/a-new-twist-intervention-con/ Webcomic Alliance: A New Twist: Intervention Con] *[https://www.wired.com/geekdad/2010/08/a-page-a-day-keeps-the-doldrums-away-duel-in-the-somme/ Wired Magazine: A Page a Day Keeps the Doldrums Away - Duel in the Somme.] *[https://www.wired.com/geekdad/2010/09/intervention-a-showcase-for-web-comics/ Wired Magazine: Intervention - A Showcase for Web Comics] *[https://www.wired.com/geekdad/2011/07/intervention-con-replicating-the-online-experience-in-a-con/ Wired Magazine: Intervention Con - Replicating the Online Experience in a Con]

{{Use Indian English|date=October 2018}} {{Use dmy dates|date=October 2018}} {{Multiple issues|{{Refimprove|date=May 2016}}{{Tone|date=May 2016}}}} The '''Jisha murder case''' was a rape and murder crime that shook the Indian state of [[Kerala]] during April 2016 and it went on to become the most publicized crime case during the Kerala Legislative elections on May 2016.
==Victim background== '''Jisha''', a 29-year-old law student at the Government Law College, Ernakulam, was found murdered on 28 April 2016 at her home near a canal in Perumbavoor in Ernakulam. She was found dead at her house on 28 April 8.30 pm by her mother Rajeswari. She was living with her mother who works as a casual labourer. Her father, Pappu<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://english.manoramaonline.com/news/kerala/2017/11/09/jisha-father-found-dead-at-home-perumbavoor.html|title=Jisha's father found dead at home|work=OnManorama|access-date=2017-11-09}}</ref>, separated from the family was staying alone and found dead on 9 November 2017 due to natural causes<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.manoramaonline.com/news/latest-news/2017/11/09/jisha-s-father-pappu-passed-away.html|title=കൊല്ലപ്പെട്ട ജിഷയുടെ പിതാവ് പാപ്പുവിനെ വീട്ടിൽ മരിച്ചനിലയിൽ കണ്ടെത്തി|work=ManoramaOnline|access-date=2017-11-09}}</ref>. Police was puzzled in the initial stage with the paranoid mother, a daily wage worker and the dysfunctional family, they also had no close contacts/cordial relationship with the neighbors or relatives, this affected the case's progress initially among other factors.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.newindianexpress.com/states/kerala/Jishas-Rape-and-Murder-was-Pre-planned-Say-Police/2016/05/07/article3419593.ece |title=Jisha's Rape and Murder was Pre-planned, Say Police |newspaper=[[The New Indian Express]] |date=2016-05-07 |accessdate=2016-07-26}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thenewsminute.com/article/jishas-killer-was-caught-her-neighbourhood-remained-unmoved-45002 |title=As Jisha’s killer was caught, her neighbourhood remained unmoved |publisher=The News Minute |date=2016-06-17 |accessdate=2016-07-26}}</ref>
==Murder== The police found the body mutilated and disturbingly sliced. Forensics concluded the body injuries showed violence, possible torture and presence of alcohol. The report also noted that the culprit had used a sharp weapon to [[disembowel]] her. Jisha was stabbed over 30 times. Her chest was pierced with a dagger. The postmortem conducted at Allappuzha Medical college states that, severe infliction on the neck led to her death. According to forensic officials, samples of blood and saliva recovered have been sent for examination, and DNA is recorded for matching. Upon preliminary investigation, the police revealed that Jisha would have been murdered when she resisted the rape attempt. The investigators also probed into migrant workers in the area for any clue on the murder.
==Case impact== The crime took place in the backdrop of the Kerala Legislative elections, and hence gained momentum and focus from political parties. As a Dalit woman brutally murdered in her home in [[Perumbavoor]], Justice for Jisha was the hashtag (#JusticeForJisha)<ref>{{cite web|url=http://english.manoramaonline.com/news/kerala/justice-for-jisha-kerala-rape-horror-law-student-perumbavoor-rape-murder.html/ |title=#JusticeForJisha: who are the culprits behind the brutal rape that shocked Kerala?|website=english.manoramaonline.com |date=2016-05-03 |accessdate=2016-07-26}}</ref> used in the social media during April 2016 to quicken efforts for justice to Jisha by politicians and largely by people. The film industry also joined forces in demanding justice for Jisha.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sify.com/movies/mollywood-unites-demanding-justice-for-jisha-news-malayalam-qferawahihjdj.html|title=Mollywood unites demanding justice for Jisha|website=Sify|access-date=2016-05-08}}</ref> The government has declared to offer a [[Solatium|financial consolation]] of Rs 10 lakh to the family of Jisha and a home will be provided for her parents. Also many artists and humanitarians pledged support to the case.<ref>{{Cite news | url = http://english.mathrubhumi.com/news/kerala/govt-announces-rs-10-lakh-to-jisha-s-family-english-news-1.1037776 | title = Govt announces Rs 10 lakh for jish's family|website=English.mathrubhumi.com | date = 2016-05-09}}</ref>
==Arrest of murderer== Through continuous search of the police and involvement of people, the Jisha murder case came through a breakthrough. A citizen hailing from Assam informed his doubts about a worker he knew to the Kerala police; following the lead they picked up the Assamese labourer, and learnt that 24-year-old Ameer-ul-Islam was the culprit and was arrested from Kancheepuram<ref>{{cite web|url=http://english.manoramaonline.com/news/just-in/jisha-murder-case-neighbour-identifies-ameerul-islam.html |title=Jisha murder case: Neighbour identifies Ameerul Islam |website=English.manoramaonline.com |date= |accessdate=2016-07-26}}</ref> in Tamil Nadu. He admitted committing the gruesome murder of the woman in Perumbavoor. Police found that the crime was motivated by previous grudge and revenge and committed under the influence of alcohol. The alcoholic assailant observed Jisha's routine and waited to sexually assault her; in that effort and rage he killed her and when she asked for water moments before death he gave her alcohol that he had with him. DNA tests conducted, matched and the police also recovered the knife used by the perpetrator.<ref>{{Cite news | url =http://www.newindianexpress.com/states/kerala/UPDATE-Jisha-murder-suspect-captured-in-Tamil-Nadu/2016/06/16/article3485349.ece | title = Murder Suspected Captured|website=Newindianexpress.com | date = 2016-06-16|accessdate=2016-07-26}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news | url =http://english.manoramaonline.com/news/just-in/jisha-murder-suspected-killer-nabbed-kerala-police.html | title = Murder Suspected nabbed |website=English.manoramaonline.com| date = 2016-06-16|accessdate=2016-07-26}}</ref> Police also suspect Anarul Islam's involvement,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://english.manoramaonline.com/news/just-in/ameerul-islam-anarul-islam-jisha-kerala-police-murder.html |title=Jisha murder: Kerala police question Ameerul's friend Anarul in Assam |website=English.manoramaonline.com |date=2016-06-20 |accessdate=2016-07-26}}</ref> a friend of Ameerul Islam who have fled after the murder news. He allegedly escaped from Assam before the arrest.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://english.manoramaonline.com/news/just-in/jisha-murder-case-ameeruls-friend-anarul-flees-from-assam.html |title=Jisha murder case: Ameerul's friend Anarul flees from Assam |website=English.manoramaonline.com |date=2016-06-20 |accessdate=2016-07-26}}</ref>
==Sentencing and aftermath== {{Unreferenced section|date=January 2017}}For premeditated murders, rape, and the use of disabling violent force, the verdict is usually [[life imprisonment]] or [[death sentence]].
The case also has motivated the government to structure a policy to halt differentiating people overly as men and women, which creates stereotyped societal divide and asked media to regulate depictions of gender-negative stereotypes to cultivate [[gender equity]], lessen the crimes as a long-term plan to a certain extent and to regulate [[yellow journalism]] in forms of discussions and unnecessary probings through media, primarily to minimize the impact of trauma. This case also made the government to actively saddle on the implementation of alcohol prohibition in a phased manner.<ref>http://english.manoramaonline.com/news/kerala/2017/12/13/beastly-brutality-on-jisha-s-body-led-cops-to-migrant-laborer-am.html</ref> The Ernakulam principal district and sessions court on Thursday 14 December 2017 life term imprisonment was awarded to Muhammed Ameer ul-Islam, an Assam native, in the sensational Jisha rape and murder case.<ref>[http://english.manoramaonline.com/news/kerala/2017/12/13/jisha-rape-and-murder-ameer-ul-islam-kochi-court-kerala.html Jisha Murder Case Verdict]</ref>
==References== {{Reflist}}
